issue.title: CSRF Failed: login/project management issues and temporary workaround
issue.body:
### Short version
Installed from source, I had an authorization problem solved by adding the local client address to the list of `CORS_ORIGIN_WHITELIST` in the backend configuration file. I think a reference to this in the documentation might help until a solution is found to make the system work out of the box.
Related to #2032 but not many details were provided there so I preferred to open a new issue to also provide my workaround.

### Long version
I followed the tutorial [Install from source](https://doccano.github.io/doccano/install_and_upgrade_doccano/#install-from-source) with the only difference being I used pip with virtualenv instead of poetry. 
After starting both frontend and backend processes, I encountered the following problems:
1. sometimes I could not login because of "wrong credentials error" even if the credentials were in fact correct.
2. even when logged in as admin,  the button to create projects did not create anything. I was always redirected to a 404 page
3. projects manually added through the django console were still not displayed by the frontend

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20610941/203400568-9dfe9c97-eb9b-4acc-ba74-3b15247a116a.png)


**Network log on client "bad credentials" error**
```
Request URL: http://192.168.1.242:3000/v1/auth/login/
Payload: {"username":"admin","password":"password"}
Response: Error occured while trying to proxy: 192.168.1.242:3000/v1/auth/login/
```

**Frontend service log on "bad credentials" error**
```
ERROR [HPM] Error occurred while proxying request 192.168.1.242:3000/v1/auth/login/ to http://127.0.0.1:8000/
[ECONNREFUSED] (https://nodejs.org/api/errors.html#errors_common_system_errors)
```

**Backend log after "create project" button click**
```
Forbidden: /v1/projects
[22/Nov/2022 19:56:21] "POST /v1/projects HTTP/1.1" 403 112
```

**Chrome network log after "create project" button click**
```
Host: 192.168.1.242:3000
Origin: http://192.168.1.242:3000
Referer: http://192.168.1.242:3000/projects/create
Request URL: http://192.168.1.242:3000/v1/projects
Request Method: POST
Status Code: 403 Forbidden
Referrer Policy: strict-origin-when-cross-origin

Response: {"detail":"CSRF Failed: Origin checking failed - http://192.168.1.242:3000 does not match any trusted origins."}

```

------
### Workaround
I have added  the ip shown by the frontend service (here http://192.168.1.242:3000) to `CORS_ORIGIN_WHITELIST` list in  `doccano\backend\config\settings\development.py`.
Had to do the same for production.

This solved all the issues I encountered related to the login and project management.

Your Environment
---------
<!-- Include details of your environment.-->
*   Operating System: Windows 10 Pro, build  19044
*   Python Version Used: 3.10.4
*   When you install doccano: 22 November 2022 (today)
*   How did you install doccano: from source (packages managed with pip)

issue.title: Autolabeling not triggered automatically
issue.body:
In the current master branch, the Autolabeling feature is not triggered when enabled on a document.
Only if i go to the next page and back to the original page the function is called and the annotations appear.

Probably was introduced [here](https://github.com/doccano/doccano/pull/1413), as it is working (for me) in 1.4.1.

How to reproduce the behaviour
---------

* Register an AutoLabelingConfig for a Sequence Labeling Project
* Open a document
* Hit `Auto Labeling` and flick the switch
* --> Nothing happens
* Go to next page and back to original page
* --> Labels are there

Also auto labeling is triggered by marking the Document as "Checked" though the UI.


Your Environment
---------
*   Operating System: Docker dev image on Manjaro Linux
*   Python Version Used: 3.8.6
*   When you install doccano: Few days ago
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc): git clone

issue.title: How to add metadata to image examples
issue.body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------
This is not a question about suspicious behavior. This is also not a general usage question. This is a specific **feature usage** question...

I am using the latest release of doccano, and I am trying to configure examples for a ImageClassification project. The import action for the examples will only allow me to upload `.png` file types, but I was wondering how I could upload metadata for individual examples. issue.title: Document Classification with a subset of potential labels based on the document
issue.body:
Feature description
---------
<!-- Please describe the feature: Which area of the library is it related to? What specific solution would you like? -->
The general idea of the request is to set up a document classification project where not every potential label is present on every single document. The best way to describe the project would be scoring the results of a multi-label classification project. After getting the results of the classification, I'd like to upload with each document a label that represents the returned results of the multi-label classification project and a label for incorrect. Currently, if you uploaded documents with different non-incorrect labels, both are added to the label section and both appear as options in the annotate section.

Example:
1. You upload a document with text and label as follows, and add to the label section a label for "incorrect".

| text   | label   |
|--------|--------|
| dog    | animal |
| apple  | fruit  |
| david  | person |
| google | animal |

2. When you enter the annotation section you see the label it was uploaded with as the selected label but all other labels as options (see screenshot below).

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/81196676/196264740-bb9ebf8a-2acb-4a9b-a0ca-eba6003abc9b.png)

Optimally, the uploaded label and the universal label we added ("incorrect") would be the only two label options that show up, such as the screenshot below.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/81196676/196265078-3ffccc7d-9325-436d-a832-96e23f29cc76.png)

It may require a new project type, please let me know how I can help!

Environment:
OS: Docker
Doccano Version: v1.8.0

comment.body:
Do you want to switch the labels displayed for each document?

For example:

| text   | display label   |
|--------|--------|
| Text A    | fruit, person |
| Text B  | animal, person  |

issue.title: CSRF Failed: login/project management issues and temporary workaround
issue.body:
### Short version
Installed from source, I had an authorization problem solved by adding the local client address to the list of `CORS_ORIGIN_WHITELIST` in the backend configuration file. I think a reference to this in the documentation might help until a solution is found to make the system work out of the box.
Related to #2032 but not many details were provided there so I preferred to open a new issue to also provide my workaround.

### Long version
I followed the tutorial [Install from source](https://doccano.github.io/doccano/install_and_upgrade_doccano/#install-from-source) with the only difference being I used pip with virtualenv instead of poetry. 
After starting both frontend and backend processes, I encountered the following problems:
1. sometimes I could not login because of "wrong credentials error" even if the credentials were in fact correct.
2. even when logged in as admin,  the button to create projects did not create anything. I was always redirected to a 404 page
3. projects manually added through the django console were still not displayed by the frontend

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20610941/203400568-9dfe9c97-eb9b-4acc-ba74-3b15247a116a.png)


**Network log on client "bad credentials" error**
```
Request URL: http://192.168.1.242:3000/v1/auth/login/
Payload: {"username":"admin","password":"password"}
Response: Error occured while trying to proxy: 192.168.1.242:3000/v1/auth/login/
```

**Frontend service log on "bad credentials" error**
```
ERROR [HPM] Error occurred while proxying request 192.168.1.242:3000/v1/auth/login/ to http://127.0.0.1:8000/
[ECONNREFUSED] (https://nodejs.org/api/errors.html#errors_common_system_errors)
```

**Backend log after "create project" button click**
```
Forbidden: /v1/projects
[22/Nov/2022 19:56:21] "POST /v1/projects HTTP/1.1" 403 112
```

**Chrome network log after "create project" button click**
```
Host: 192.168.1.242:3000
Origin: http://192.168.1.242:3000
Referer: http://192.168.1.242:3000/projects/create
Request URL: http://192.168.1.242:3000/v1/projects
Request Method: POST
Status Code: 403 Forbidden
Referrer Policy: strict-origin-when-cross-origin

Response: {"detail":"CSRF Failed: Origin checking failed - http://192.168.1.242:3000 does not match any trusted origins."}

```

------
### Workaround
I have added  the ip shown by the frontend service (here http://192.168.1.242:3000) to `CORS_ORIGIN_WHITELIST` list in  `doccano\backend\config\settings\development.py`.
Had to do the same for production.

This solved all the issues I encountered related to the login and project management.

Your Environment
---------
<!-- Include details of your environment.-->
*   Operating System: Windows 10 Pro, build  19044
*   Python Version Used: 3.10.4
*   When you install doccano: 22 November 2022 (today)
*   How did you install doccano: from source (packages managed with pip)

issue.title: Autolabeling not triggered automatically
issue.body:
In the current master branch, the Autolabeling feature is not triggered when enabled on a document.
Only if i go to the next page and back to the original page the function is called and the annotations appear.

Probably was introduced [here](https://github.com/doccano/doccano/pull/1413), as it is working (for me) in 1.4.1.

How to reproduce the behaviour
---------

* Register an AutoLabelingConfig for a Sequence Labeling Project
* Open a document
* Hit `Auto Labeling` and flick the switch
* --> Nothing happens
* Go to next page and back to original page
* --> Labels are there

Also auto labeling is triggered by marking the Document as "Checked" though the UI.


Your Environment
---------
*   Operating System: Docker dev image on Manjaro Linux
*   Python Version Used: 3.8.6
*   When you install doccano: Few days ago

issue.body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------
<!-- Before submitting an issue, make sure to check the docs and closed issues and FAQ to see if any of the solutions work for you. https://github.com/doccano/doccano/wiki/Frequently-Asked-Questions -->

I am able create a relation label between two span labels in the UI, however the relation array get exported empty when going through the Export Dataset -> JSONL(relation) path. Furthermore, issues occur when trying to import relations as well. The import dataset flow only takes one "Column Label" field. }

The second goal would be the ability to upload span labels and relation labels. Basically, Import Dataset should work with the Export Dataset -> JSONL(relation) results. I'll include a JSONL testing file for imports.

issue.title: Document Classification with a subset of potential labels based on the document
issue.body:
Feature description
---------
<!-- Please describe the feature: Which area of the library is it related to? What specific solution would you like? -->
The general idea of the request is to set up a document classification project where not every potential label is present on every single document. The best way to describe the project would be scoring the results of a multi-label classification project. After getting the results of the classification, I'd like to upload with each document a label that represents the returned results of the multi-label classification project and a label for incorrect. Currently, if you uploaded documents with different non-incorrect labels, both are added to the label section and both appear as options in the annotate section.

Example:
1. You upload a document with text and label as follows, and add to the label section a label for "incorrect".

| text   | label   |
|--------|--------|
| dog    | animal |
| apple  | fruit  |
| david  | person |
| google | animal |

2. When you enter the annotation section you see the label it was uploaded with as the selected label but all other labels as options (see screenshot below).

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/81196676/196264740-bb9ebf8a-2acb-4a9b-a0ca-eba6003abc9b.png)

Optimally, the uploaded label and the universal label we added ("incorrect") would be the only two label options that show up, such as the screenshot below.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/81196676/196265078-3ffccc7d-9325-436d-a832-96e23f29cc76.png)

It may require a new project type, please let me know how I can help!

Environment:
OS: Docker
Doccano Version: v1.8.0

comment.body:
Do you want to switch the labels displayed for each document?

For example:

|--------|--------|
| Text A    | fruit, person |
| Text B  | animal, person  |

issue.title: CSRF Failed: login/project management issues and temporary workaround
issue.body:
### Short version
Installed from source, I had an authorization problem solved by adding the local client address to the list of `CORS_ORIGIN_WHITELIST` in the backend configuration file. I think a reference to this in the documentation might help until a solution is found to make the system work out of the box.
Related to #2032 but not many details were provided there so I preferred to open a new issue to also provide my workaround.

### Long version
I followed the tutorial [Install from source](https://doccano.github.io/doccano/install_and_upgrade_doccano/#install-from-source) with the only difference being I used pip with virtualenv instead of poetry. 
After starting both frontend and backend processes, I encountered the following problems:
1. sometimes I could not login because of "wrong credentials error" even if the credentials were in fact correct.
2. even when logged in as admin,  the button to create projects did not create anything. I was always redirected to a 404 page
3. projects manually added through the django console were still not displayed by the frontend

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20610941/203400568-9dfe9c97-eb9b-4acc-ba74-3b15247a116a.png)


**Network log on client "bad credentials" error**
```
Request URL: http://192.168.1.242:3000/v1/auth/login/
Payload: {"username":"admin","password":"password"}
Response: Error occured while trying to proxy: 192.168.1.242:3000/v1/auth/login/
```

**Frontend service log on "bad credentials" error**
```
ERROR [HPM] Error occurred while proxying request 192.168.1.242:3000/v1/auth/login/ to http://127.0.0.1:8000/
[ECONNREFUSED] (https://nodejs.org/api/errors.html#errors_common_system_errors)
```

**Backend log after "create project" button click**
```
Forbidden: /v1/projects
[22/Nov/2022 19:56:21] "POST /v1/projects HTTP/1.1" 403 112
```

**Chrome network log after "create project" button click**
```
Host: 192.168.1.242:3000
Origin: http://192.168.1.242:3000
Referer: http://192.168.1.242:3000/projects/create
Request URL: http://192.168.1.242:3000/v1/projects
Request Method: POST
Status Code: 403 Forbidden
Referrer Policy: strict-origin-when-cross-origin

Response: {"detail":"CSRF Failed: Origin checking failed - http://192.168.1.242:3000 does not match any trusted origins."}

```

------
### Workaround
I have added  the ip shown by the frontend service (here http://192.168.1.242:3000) to `CORS_ORIGIN_WHITELIST` list in  `doccano\backend\config\settings\development.py`.
Had to do the same for production.

This solved all the issues I encountered related to the login and project management.

Your Environment
---------
<!-- Include details of your environment.-->
*   Operating System: Windows 10 Pro, build  19044
*   Python Version Used: 3.10.4
*   When you install doccano: 22 November 2022 (today)
*   How did you install doccano: from source (packages managed with pip)

issue.title: CSRF verification failed. Request aborted. More information is available with DEBUG=True.
issue.body:
I deploy this system using docker-compose and I am able to login normally in the Web UI, but when I login through the http://127.0.0.1/admin get a Forbidden (403).

![](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/pujichun/image/main/img/20220516174705.png)

Sometimes I can directly enter the background management system, but as long as the form is submitted, the problem still occurs.

I have never used Django, so I'd like to ask why this is ?

issue.title: Autolabeling not triggered automatically
issue.body:
In the current master branch, the Autolabeling feature is not triggered when enabled on a document.
Only if i go to the next page and back to the original page the function is called and the annotations appear.

Probably was introduced [here](https://github.com/doccano/doccano/pull/1413), as it is working (for me) in 1.4.1.

How to reproduce the behaviour
---------

* Register an AutoLabelingConfig for a Sequence Labeling Project
* Open a document
* Hit `Auto Labeling` and flick the switch
* --> Nothing happens
* Go to next page and back to original page
* --> Labels are there

Also auto labeling is triggered by marking the Document as "Checked" though the UI.


Your Environment
---------
*   Operating System: Docker dev image on Manjaro Linux
*   Python Version Used: 3.8.6
*   When you install doccano: Few days ago
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc): git clone

issue.title: How to add metadata to image examples
issue.body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------
This is not a question about suspicious behavior. This is also not a general usage question. This is a specific **feature usage** question...

I am using the latest release of doccano, and I am trying to configure examples for a ImageClassification project. The import action for the examples will only allow me to upload `.png` file types, but I was wondering how I could upload metadata for individual examples. In the example in the deployed demo of doccano on Heroku, [this example has URL metadata](https://doccano.herokuapp.com/demo/image-classification), which I am interested in replicating in my project.

issue.title: How can I get the comment data under the samples？
Broken: Importing and Exporting SequenceLabeling projects with relations
issue.body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------
<!-- Before submitting an issue, make sure to check the docs and closed issues and FAQ to see if any of the solutions work for you. https://github.com/doccano/doccano/wiki/Frequently-Asked-Questions -->

<!-- Include a code example or the steps that led to the problem. Please try to be as specific as possible. -->

Your Environment
---------
<!-- Include details of your environment.-->
*   Operating System: Dockeer
*   Python Version Used: 3.8
*   When you install doccano: 11/1/22
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc): docker-compose

I observed issues with the UI and interacting with relation labels. I am able create a relation label between two span labels in the UI, however the relation array get exported empty when going through the Export Dataset -> JSONL(relation) path. Furthermore, issues occur when trying to import relations as well. The import dataset flow only takes one "Column Label" field. When that is set to label, all of the span label and relation label info are uploaded as metadata. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/81196676/199328801-c98d3693-ff8f-45b3-80a3-7d916075ec56.png)

If the "Column Label" field is set to "entities" the span labels are imported and only the relation label data is uploaded as metadata. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/81196676/199329062-26b1ea53-8b03-464d-932e-15e0b0e83061.png)

The first goal would be that the export process, exports in the format displayed when you select the JSONL(relation) option from Export Dataset.

ie.

```
{
    "text": "Google was founded on September 4, 1998, by Larry Page and Sergey Brin.",
    "entities": [
        {
            "id": 0,
            "start_offset": 0,
            "end_offset": 6,
            "label": "ORG"
        },
        {
            "id": 1,
            "start_offset": 22,
            "end_offset": 39,
            "label": "DATE"
        },
        {
            "id": 2,
            "start_offset": 44,
            "end_offset": 54,
            "label": "PERSON"
        },
        {
            "id": 3,
            "start_offset": 59,
            "end_offset": 70,
            "label": "PERSON"
        }
    ],
    "relations": [
        {
            "id": 0,
            "from_id": 0,
            "to_id": 1,
            "type": "foundedAt"
        },
        {
            "id": 1,
            "from_id": 0,
            "to_id": 2,
            "type": "foundedBy"
        },
        {
            "id": 2,
            "from_id": 0,
            "to_id": 3,
            "type": "foundedBy"
        }
    ]
}
```

The second goal would be the ability to upload span labels and relation labels. Basically, Import Dataset should work with the Export Dataset -> JSONL(relation) results. I'll include a JSONL testing file for imports.

[relation_import_sample.zip](https://github.com/doccano/doccano/files/9913661/relation_import_sample.zip)

issue.title: Document Classification with a subset of potential labels based on the document
issue.body:
Feature description
---------
<!-- Please describe the feature: Which area of the library is it related to? What specific solution would you like? -->
The general idea of the request is to set up a document classification project where not every potential label is present on every single document. The best way to describe the project would be scoring the results of a multi-label classification project. After getting the results of the classification, I'd like to upload with each document a label that represents the returned results of the multi-label classification project and a label for incorrect. Currently, if you uploaded documents with different non-incorrect labels, both are added to the label section and both appear as options in the annotate section.

Example:
1. You upload a document with text and label as follows, and add to the label section a label for "incorrect".

| text   | label   |
|--------|--------|
| dog    | animal |
| apple  | fruit  |
| david  | person |
| google | animal |

2. When you enter the annotation section you see the label it was uploaded with as the selected label but all other labels as options (see screenshot below).

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/81196676/196264740-bb9ebf8a-2acb-4a9b-a0ca-eba6003abc9b.png)

Optimally, the uploaded label and the universal label we added ("incorrect") would be the only two label options that show up, such as the screenshot below.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/81196676/196265078-3ffccc7d-9325-436d-a832-96e23f29cc76.png)

It may require a new project type, please let me know how I can help!

Environment:
OS: Docker
Doccano Version: v1.8.0

comment.body:
Do you want to switch the labels displayed for each document?

For example:

| text   | display label   |
|--------|--------|
| Text A    | fruit, person |
| Text B  | animal, person  |
